intro: Foveolaria ovata, commonly known as the ovate foveolaria, is a species of marine polychaete annelid. It belongs to the family Spiochyridae and is characterized by its small, elongated body with a distinct head and segmented trunk. The plant, more accurately a worm, exhibits a simple yet efficient structure with a burrowing lifestyle in sandy or muddy substrates. Its body is covered in fine setae, which aid in locomotion and anchoring. Foveolaria ovata plays a role in benthic ecosystems by contributing to sediment mixing and serving as prey for various marine organisms.
